organization_profile.name: Team Rakshak
organization_profile.address: Main Gate Rd, IIT Area, Powai, Mumbai, Maharashtra 400076, India

contact.location: Aerospace Engineering Department, Main Building, IIT Bombay

organization_profile.mission_statement: Team Rakshak is a student UAV team at IIT Bombay dedicated to engineering drones for disaster relief and aerospace innovation. We develop robust Unmanned Aerial Vehicles (UAVs) to support Search and Rescue Operations (SRO) in disaster-stricken areas, surveys, mapping, and wildlife conservation.
organization_profile.engineering_overview: Team Rakshak designs and builds UAVs entirely from the ground up, integrating airframe design, avionics, and onboard intelligence as a single cohesive system. Our multirotor and fixed-wing platforms are developed in-house, from aerodynamic design and composite manufacturing to electronics integration and control-law tuning. The quadcopter platform that secured 1st place at CUASC was the result of this full-stack approach, combining a custom airframe, in-house electronics, and extensive flight tuning. Since the inception of the team, we have continuously redesigned fixed-wing UAVs, improving aerodynamic efficiency, composite structures, and system reliability each year. Alongside this, we have developed large custom multirotor platforms focused on heavy-payload capability. On the software side, autonomy is implemented entirely in-house, leveraging reinforcement learning-based control and Jetson-powered onboard perception to enable GPS-denied navigation and intelligent decision-making.
taglines: Engineering the future, one UAV at a time

faculty_advisors.name: Prof. Rohit Vishwajit Nanavati
faculty_advisors.description: Guiding the team with expertise and experience in aerospace engineering.

faculty_advisors.name: Prof. Dwaipayan Mukherjee
faculty_advisors.description: Providing technical guidance and industry insights.

fleet_specifications.name: Ares
fleet_specifications.description: A high-performance UAV developed for the UAS Challenge 2024, featuring a carbon fiber airframe with water-resistant EPP wings and a modular, tool-free assembly that can be completed in under two minutes. The platform supports autonomous takeoff and landing, waypoint-based navigation, and precision payload drop capabilities.

fleet_specifications.name: Skywalker
fleet_specifications.description: Designed for AUVSI-SUAS. Fully autonomous operation including object detection, classification, interoperability, and waypoint navigation.

fleet_specifications.name: Sandy 2.0
fleet_specifications.description: Twin-motor variant of Sandy. Highly stable with vertical loop capabilities. Used for testing image capture features.

fleet_specifications.name: Sandy
fleet_specifications.description: Small plane for component testing. First test dummy for autonomous flying algorithms.

fleet_specifications.name: Smokey
fleet_specifications.description: First plane in the team's history to feature ingrained autonomous systems.

fleet_specifications.name: SAE Plane
fleet_specifications.description: Represented the team in SAE-2015. 7th place in Design.

competitions_and_projects.title: Air Cargo Challenge
competitions_and_projects.description: Inspired by the North American DBF competition. A design, build, and fly challenge for university students, organized biennially.

competitions_and_projects.title: AUVSI SUAS
competitions_and_projects.description: Requires students to design a UAS capable of autonomous flight, navigation, and remote sensing via onboard payload sensors.

competitions_and_projects.title: Smart India Hackathon
competitions_and_projects.description: A nationwide initiative providing students a platform to solve pressing problems, inculcating a culture of product innovation.

competitions_and_projects.title: UAS Challenge (IMechE)
competitions_and_projects.description: Full design and build cycle of a 10kg UAS for specific autonomous mission objectives, culminating in a final fly-off event.

competitions_and_projects.title: Youth Conclave (INAE)
competitions_and_projects.description: Engineering students prepare a complete report on a problem statement and arrive at a detailed case study and strategy.

competitions_and_projects.title: SAE Aero Design
competitions_and_projects.description: Designing aircraft to lift maximum payload under strict constraints.

competitions_and_projects.title: Aerospace Innovation
competitions_and_projects.description: Pushing boundaries of conventional design through cutting-edge research.

software.title: Software & Intelligence
software.description: Developing onboard intelligence for UAVs using real-time vision, edge computing, and machine learning to detect, classify, and geotag mission targets.
software.focus: Vision-based autonomy for GPS-denied environments with real-time edge-AI optimization.
workstreams: Vision-based navigation using optical flow (Python, OpenCV, ROS2)
Edge AI deployment on Jetson platforms (C++, CUDA, TensorRT)
Sub-15ms onboard inference for object detection
Autonomous geotagging and server-side data upload (interoperability)

repositories.name: NIDAR 2025
repositories.desc: Complete autonomy and perception stack developed for the NIDAR competition.

repositories.name: Research & Development
repositories.desc: Research work on drone-to-drone communication and advanced imaging techniques.

repositories.name: CUASC 2025 Code
repositories.desc: Competition-tested autonomy controllers and mission logic used at CUASC 2025.

repositories.name: Lufthansa 2024 R&D
repositories.desc: Collaborative research material including reports and experimental notebooks.

aerodynamics.title: Aerodynamics & Manufacturing
aerodynamics.tagline: Airframe Design, Composites, and Structural Engineering
aerodynamics.description: Responsible for the complete airframe design, aerodynamic analysis, material selection, and manufacturing of fixed-wing and multirotor platforms.
aerodynamics.focus: Airfoil analysis, composite structures, and manufacturable high-performance airframes.

technical_sections.title: Airfoil Analysis & Selection
technical_sections.content: Extensive XFLR5 analysis of multiple airfoils including NACA 4412, S1221, E222, E854, and MH-113. NACA 4412 selected for wings due to superior low-AoA efficiency and stability; NACA 0012 chosen for tail surfaces.

technical_sections.title: Materials & Structures
technical_sections.content: Use of prepreg carbon fibre (TENAX UMS), ROHACELL IG-F foam cores, aluminium internal structures (laser-cut ribs), and hybrid 3D-printed components (PLA/TPU) optimized for strength-to-weight ratio.

technical_sections.title: Composite Manufacturing
technical_sections.content: Autoclave-cured carbon fibre components at 120Â°C and 4 bar pressure. Semi-monocoque fuselage design with precision aluminium moulds and epoxy bonding.

technical_sections.title: Stability & Configuration
technical_sections.content: Static margin estimation, CG optimization, downwash angle analysis, and tail sizing using XFLR5 and empirical design methods.

technical_sections.title: Payload Systems & Deployment
technical_sections.content: Design and integration of payload deployment mechanisms for precise delivery of cargo, including provisions for deploying a UGV payload capable of navigating to target locations post-drop.

avionics.title: Avionics & Control
avionics.tagline: Electronics, Sensing, and Flight Control Systems
avionics.description: Designing and integrating the electronic, sensing, and control systems that enable stable, autonomous, and reliable flight.
avionics.focus: Flight controllers, sensors, communication systems, and control-law tuning for fixed-wing and multirotor UAVs.

work_areas.title: Flight Control & Tuning
work_areas.desc: Design and tuning of control laws for fixed-wing and multirotor platforms, including PID tuning through extensive flight testing across multiple configurations.

work_areas.title: Sensor Integration & Calibration
work_areas.desc: Integration and calibration of IMUs, GPS, barometers, magnetometers, and other sensors to ensure reliable state estimation and robust flight performance.

work_areas.title: Communication Systems
work_areas.desc: Implementation of reliable communication links between UAVs, ground control stations, and servers, including telemetry, command, and data transfer.

work_areas.title: Autonomous Navigation & Mission Execution
work_areas.desc: Implementation of MAVLink-based autonomous navigation including path planning, obstacle avoidance, autonomous takeoff and landing, and execution of mission logic in coordination with onboard software systems.

work_areas.title: System Integration & Testing
work_areas.desc: End-to-end integration of airframe, avionics, and software, followed by structured ground tests and flight tests to validate system reliability.

business.title: Business & Marketing
business.description: Handles non-technical work including sponsorships, industry partnerships, publicity, accounts, logistics, social media, and design & graphics.
